clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Regional Anaesthetic Blocks for ERAS After Congenital Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Pectointercostal Block and Transverse Thoracic Plane Block for ERAS Post Congenital Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The current study is designed to compare the perioperative analgesic efficacy of transversus thoracis plane block (TTPB) and Pecto-intercostal-fascial plane block (PIFB) in children undergoing cardiac surgery via median sternotomy

detailed_description.textblock: Sixty paediatric patients of either sex, aged 2-12 years, undergoing elective cardiac surgery via median sternotomy. Patients will be excluded from the current study in case of, refusal to participate, redo or urgent cardiac surgery, local infection of the skin at the site of needle puncture, allergy to bupivacaine, coagulation disorders, clinically significant liver or kidney disease, heart failure, moderate to severe pulmonary hypertension, and when extubation is intentionally planned to be delayed. Patients will be randomly assigned to one of two equal groups, the PIF block group and TTP block group, each will include 30 patients, by a computer-generated randomization table and concealed sealed opaque envelopes.

primary_outcome.description: Weight in kg and height in cm to allow BMI measurement weight (kg) / height (m2)
Postoperative pain score at rest, hemodynamic effects, analgesic consumption

arm_group.description: After induction of anaesthesia, ultrasound guided transverses thoracis muscle plane block will be done using 0.25% bupivacaine
After induction of anaesthesia, ultrasound guided pectointercostal facial plane block will be done using 0.25% bupivacaine

intervention.description: Regional anaesthesia for sternotomy incision for congenital cardiac surgery
